0: Space is open to us now and our eagerness to share its meaning is not
5: governed by the efforts of others. We go into space because whatever mankind must
11: undertake free men must fully share.
20: I therefore ask the Congress above and beyond the increases I have earlier
25: requested for space activities to provide the funds which are needed to
29: meet the following national goals: FirstI believe that this nation should commit
34: itself to achieving the goal before this decade is out of landing a man on the
41: moon and returning him safely to the earth.
43: No single space project in this period will be more impressive to mankind or
50: more important for the long-range exploration of space and none will be so
55: difficult or expensive to accomplish we propose to accelerate the development of
61: the appropriate lunar spacecraft. We propose to develop alternate liquid and
66: solid fuel boosters much larger than any now being developed until certain which
72: is superior. We propose additional funds for other engine development and for
78: unmanned exploration -- explorations which are particularly important for one
84: purpose which this nation will never overlook -- the survival of the man who
89: first makes this daring flight. But in avery real sense it will not be one man
95: going to the moon. We make this judgment affirmatively it will be an entire
100: nation -- for all of us must work to put him there.
